title: Designing Self-Directed Thermodynamics Learning Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Asynchronous learning environment for office/administrative professionals using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: The First and Second Laws of Thermodynamics can be explained through mathematical modeling and applied to real-world cases.
Multi-variable problems can be solved using the concept of partial molar entropy for entropy change calculations.
The ability to interpret Gibbs free energy diagrams and predict chemical equilibrium conditions is developed.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
